title: A Simple and Light Weight External Fixator for Distraction Advancement Manoplasty
patient: A 26 year old Taxi driver with amputation of index and long fingers from a childhood accident requested lengthening of the stumps so he can wear finger prostheses ( and ). The remaining phalanges were too short for distraction with two parallel pins so we inserted a small two holes plate at the osteotomy site in order to get more anchorage for distraction. The distraction was successful and a length of 24 mm was achieved which was bone grafted at the second stage ( and ). The graft healed but with some volar bending of the proximal bones. After a web deepening procedure with skin graft he was able to wear the finger prostheses he had requested ().
